question: 8) Physics – Multiple Choice Which of the following is necessarily true regarding capacitors? W) For capacitance in parallel, the equivalent capacitance is less than that of any individual capacitor X) For capacitance in parallel, the equivalent capacitance is the sum of reciprocals of the individual capacitors Y) For capacitance in series, the equivalent capacitance is less than that of any individual capacitor Z) For capacitance in series, the equivalent capacitance is the sum of the individual capacitors
answer:
Y) FOR CAPACITANCE IN SERIES, THE EQUIVALENT CAPACITANCE IS
LESS THAN THAT OF ANY INDIVIDUAL CAPACITOR
